A man taking a jumping selfie with Jump-In-Front Camera without being constraint to holding the camera.

Typical selfies constrain the users to holding the camera at arm\'s length.\n \n Hands-Free Selfie Camera frees you to put the photo down, run around, jump, and pose to your heart\'s content. Jump-In-Front Camera takes a photo every second (customizable) to be sure to capture all the special moments.
An illustration to suggest a grid of photos.

The best photographers take hundreds or even thousands of photos to capture that one perfect shot.\n \n Hands-Free Selfie Camera comes with a photo review tool to organize the photos and discard the rest.

Jump-In-Front Camera is an app that takes photos on its own in a regular interval. It's like a ghost that photographs you.
 
 If you want to take a selfie, the back facing camera makes higher quality photos. Putting the camera down instead of holding it steps up the photo quality another notch. But how do you trigger the photos then? A timer takes one photo. With Hands-Free Selfie Camera, you can make the phone take a series of photos while you post. At the end, simply look through the photos and pick the best one.

When taking a group photo, there is often a runner. The runner presses the timer button and runs to the group. Some smart people simply turn on a video and screen grab the perfect shot out of it. The problem is that the camera can make higher quality photos for still shots than ongoing video. So, Jump-In-Front Camera comes to the rescue. It'll steadily snap photos at the highest still photo quality. You pick the best one and delete the rest.
